discussion.content: Vote D, Admin console does not allow bulk changes for Groups
A is correct. Because the question mentioned, "now you are planning to manage groups directly from Google". So it clearly said we have to focus on the only G admin console.

Selected Answer: D
You can use the bulk upload with CSV feature in the G Suite Admin panel to update membership of groups, one by one. Here we need to update groups settings. It can only be done with Groups Settings API, with an App Script or using GAM for instance.

who can post, who can join, this setting cant configure via bulk, but if use API example GAM

The default permissions of the Group can't be changed, however, you can change the Group settings once the Group is created.

questions.question_text:
You are using Google Cloud Directory Sync to manage users. You performed an initial sync of nearly 1,000 mailing lists to Google Groups with Google Cloud
Directory Sync and now are planning to manage groups directly from Google. Over half the groups have been configured with incorrect settings, including who can post, who can join, and which groups can have external members. You need to update groups to be configured correctly.
What should you do?

choices.A: Use the bulk upload with CSV feature in the G Suite Admin panel to update all Groups.
choices.C: Create and assign a custom admin role for all group owners so they can update settings.
choices.D: Use the Groups Settings API to update Google Groups with desired settings.
choices.B: Update your configuration file and resync mailing lists with Google Cloud Directory Sync.

choices.C: Create Admin Alerts, and use the Security Center to audit whether admins manage countries other than their own.
choices.D: Create a Team Drive per OU, and allow only country-specific administration of each folder.
choices.B: Create an OU for each country. Create an admin role and assign an admin with that role per OU.
choices.A: Establish a new GSuite tenant with their own admin for each region.

questions.question_text:
Your client is a multinational company with a single email domain. The client has compliance requirements and policies that vary by country. You need to configure the environment so that each country has their own administrator and no administrator can manage another country.
What should you do?

discussion.content: B is correct, since they have a single domain, so it is impossible to have new admin panel
Correct answer is A

Selected Answer: B
correct answer is B
Hmmm A lot of admin roles can't be assigned by OU, domain only
B is correct
B is the correct answer

B is correct answer here.

https://support.google.com/a/answer/6129577?hl=en#:~:text=Create%20and%20assign%20the%20role&text=Click%20Assign%20role.,organizational%20unit%20and%20click%20Done.

comments.content: agreed but you can create a custom role just grant the necessary permission. Additionally, the Q clearly states that there is only one domain for all the countries therefore you cannot have more than one account for the company.

Should be A, sub-admin per OU is only restricted to manage user and no other privileges can be assigned.

choices.D: Create an app using AppMaker and App Script.

questions.question_text:
In your organization, users have been provisioned with either G Suite Enterprise, G Suite Business, or no license, depending on their job duties, and the cost of user licenses is paid out of each division's budget. In order to effectively manage the license disposition, team leaders require the ability to look up the type of license that is currently assigned, along with the last logon date, for their direct reports.
You have been tasked with recommending a solution to the Director of IT, and have gathered the following requirements:
✑ Team leaders must be able to retrieve this data on their own (i.e., self-service).
✑ Team leaders are not permitted to have any level of administrative access to the G Suite Admin panel.
✑ Team leaders must only be able to look up data for their direct reports.
✑ The data must always be current to within 1 week.
✑ Costs must be mitigated.
What approach should you recommend?

discussion.content: should be B&D because it concerns "changes that are made to the G Suite environment"

Selected Answer: BD
Changes that are made to the G Suite environment, not only to Drive
I believe C and E are correct. Admin Audit Log shows administrator's activities.
B+D is correct
CEO is concerned with data related to drive only.
I will also go with B and D option as A doesnt export log and since CEO want to see all changes in Gsuite hence B and D is correct options

questions.question_text:
Your organization has been on G Suite Enterprise for one year. Recently, an admin turned on public link sharing for Drive files without permission from security.
Your CTO wants to get better insight into changes that are made to the G Suite environment. The chief security officer wants that data brought into your existing
SIEM system.
What are two ways you should accomplish this? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Use the Data Export Tool to export admin audit data to your existing SIEM system
choices.D: Use the BigQuery export to send admin audit data to the existing SIEM system via custom code
choices.E: Use the BigQuery export to send drive audit data to the existing SIEM system via custom code.
choices.B: Use Apps Script and the Reports API to export admin audit data to your existing SIEM system.
choices.C: Use Apps Script and the Reports API to export drive audit data to the existing SIEM system
Deploy Hangouts Meet Hardware Kits to each executive office, and associate the Meet hardware with the executives' calendars.
choices.A: Set up unmanaged Chromeboxes and set the executives' homepage to meet.google.com via Chrome settings.
choices.B: Set up the executive offices as reservable Calendar Resources, deploy Hangouts Meet Hardware Kits, and associate the Meet hardware with the room calendars.
choices.D: Provision managed Chromeboxes and set the executives' Chrome homepage to meet. google.com via device policy.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Question states that hardware including more than chromeboxes needs to be in these rooms. So that eliminates D. Answer is C.

Selected Answer: C
correct answer is C
C is correct
C is correcr

(C)- https://support.google.com/meethardware/answer/3341435?hl=en
If the device is for a single user, such as in a home office or other remote location, you can associate the device with their personal calendar. Whenever an organizer adds that user to a Calendar event, the meeting name appears on their device.
No Brainer C is correct option.
C is correct

questions.question_text:
The company's ten most senior executives are to have their offices outfitted with dedicated, standardized video conference cameras, microphones, and screens.
The goal is to reduce the amount of technical support they require due to frequent, habitual switching between various mobile and PC devices throughout their busy days. You must ensure that it is easier for the executives to join Meet video conferences with the dedicated equipment instead of whatever device they happen to have available.
What should you do?
